intro: Jupunba microcalyx var. microcalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved jupunba, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem, giving it a delicate appearance. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Due to its ornamental value and unique botanical features, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
